There is an active course evulation. Participation is highly appreciated:
The course starts on April 17 at 10:15 a.m. in room H 0106.
The module 'Water Treatment' consists of an integrated course (IV) and a practical exercise (PR) in the summer semester.

Each part is worth 3 credit points (ECTS). The examination is oral, and the overall evaluation considers reports of the PR (10% each, together 40%). According to the latest statement of the 'Prüfungsamt' the course should be completed as module with 6 credit points. The course can be attended as 'Freie Wahl' or within the 'Ergänzungsbereich' in the Master program.
The participants gain knowledge about drinking water supply including sources, water works and boundary conditions:
• Overview of drinking water resources and the respective supply structure in Germany
• Knowledge on typical and challenging water constituents and their relevance
• Understanding of major drinking water treatment options and the underlying removal mechanisms
• Information about regulations and technical standards for drinking water supply and responsibilities
The course mainly focusses on technical aspects of drinking water treatment but also addresses organizational and regulatory aspects.
• Water resources used for water supply
• Organic, inorganic and microbial constituents/contaminants and respective removal options
• Close-to-nature treatments such as bank filtration, artificial groundwater infiltration and slow sand filtration
• Physical treatments such as sedimentation, rapid sand filtration and membrane filtration
• Chemical treatments such flocculation, pH and hardness control
• Adsorptive treatments with activated carbon and ion exchange
